org.apache.juneau.html

Class HtmlSerializerSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Session
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanSession
        • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerSession
          • org.apache.juneau.xml.XmlSerializerSession
            • org.apache.juneau.html.HtmlSerializerSession
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HtmlDocSerializerSession

    public class HtmlSerializerSession
extends XmlSerializerSession
    Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of HtmlSerializer.

    This class is NOT thread safe. It is meant to be discarded after one-time use.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HtmlSerializerSession

        protected HtmlSerializerSession(HtmlSerializerContext ctx,
                                ObjectMap op,
                                Object output,
                                Method javaMethod,
                                Locale locale,
                                TimeZone timeZone,
                                MediaType mediaType)
        Create a new session using properties specified in the context.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context creating this session object. The context contains all the configuration settings for this object.
        output - The output object. See JsonSerializerSession.getWriter() for valid class types.
        op - The override properties. These override any context properties defined in the context.
        javaMethod - The java method that called this serializer, usually the method in a REST servlet.
        locale - The session locale. If null, then the locale defined on the context is used.
        timeZone - The session timezone. If null, then the timezone defined on the context is used.
        mediaType - The session media type (e.g. "application/json").

    • Method Detail

      • getWriter

        public HtmlWriter getWriter()
                     throws Exception
        Description copied from class: SerializerSession
        Wraps the specified output object inside a writer. Subclasses can override this method to implement their own specialized writers.

        This method can be used if the output object is any of the following class types:

        • Writer
        • OutputStream - Output will be written as UTF-8 encoded stream.
        • File - Output will be written as system-default encoded stream.
        Overrides:
        getWriter in class XmlSerializerSession
        Returns:
        The output object wrapped in a Writer.
        Throws:
        Exception - If object could not be converted to a writer.

      • isUri

        public boolean isUri(ClassMeta<?> cm,
                     BeanPropertyMeta pMeta,
                     Object o)
        Returns true if the specified object is a URL.
        Parameters:
        cm - The ClassMeta of the object being serialized.
        pMeta - The property metadata of the bean property of the object. Can be null if the object isn't from a bean property.
        o - The object.
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is a URL.

      • isHtmlMode

        public boolean isHtmlMode()
        Description copied from class: XmlSerializerSession
        Returns true if we're serializing HTML.

        The difference in behavior is how empty non-void elements are handled. The XML serializer will produce a collapsed tag, whereas the HTML serializer will produce a start and end tag.

        Overrides:
        isHtmlMode in class XmlSerializerSession
        Returns:
        true if we're generating HTML.
